subject: Blockchain & Web3
title: Smart Contracts 101
description: Code that enforces itself in 60 seconds.

hook.text: What if contracts could enforce themselves? No lawyers. No courts. Just code.

buildup.text: Think of a vending machine: insert money, get snack. The rules are automatic and unstoppable.

discovery.text: Smart contracts are programs on the blockchain. When conditions are met, they execute automatically.

twist.text: Pay rent late? The smart contract could automatically charge a fee. No human needed.

climax.text: But beware: bugs in smart contracts can't be fixed. Millions have been lost to code errors.

punchline.text: Smart contracts: agreements that run exactly as written, for better or worse.

quiz.question: Why are smart contract bugs so dangerous?
options: Once deployed, the code cannot be changed
